N18/2/ANENG/SP1/ENG/TZ0/XX/M




                                     Markscheme
                                  Barème de notation
                                Esquema de calificación
                     November / Novembre / Noviembre de 2018

                               English / Anglais / Inglés ab initio

                                         Standard level
                                         Niveau moyen
                                          Nivel medio

                                  Paper / Épreuve / Prueba 1


8 pages/páginas
                                     –2–                                      N18/2/ANENG/SP1/ENG/TZ0/XX/M




This markscheme is the property of the International Baccalaureate and
must not be reproduced or distributed to any other person without the
authorization of the IB Global Centre, Cardiff.

Ce barème de notation est la propriété du Baccalauréat International.
Toute reproduction ou distribution à de tierces personnes sans
l’autorisation préalable du centre mondial de l’IB à Cardiff est interdite.

Este esquema de calificación es propiedad del Bachillerato Internacional
y no debe ser reproducido ni distribuido a ninguna otra persona sin la
autorización del centro global del IB en Cardiff.
                                                                             –3–                                         N18/2/ANENG/SP1/ENG/TZ0/XX/M

1. For questions where short answers are required, the answer must be clear. Do not award the mark if the answer does not make sense or if the
   additional information makes the answer ambiguous, incorrect or incomprehensible.
2. Allow spelling mistakes so long as they do not hinder comprehension or do not change the sense of the phrase.
3. For true or false questions, candidates may use a tick or a cross to indicate their intended response but usage must be consistent. If a candidate
   writes two ticks or two crosses for the same answer award [0]. If a candidate answers with a cross and a tick for the same answer, mark the tick and
   ignore the cross.
4. For questions where the candidate has to write a letter in a box (for example, multiple choice questions), if a candidate has written two answers – one
   in the box and one outside – only mark the answer inside the box.
5. The total number of marks for the question paper is [40].

1. En ce qui concerne les questions pour lesquelles des réponses brèves sont attendues, la réponse donnée doit être claire. N’attribuez pas de points si
   la réponse n’a aucun sens ou si les informations supplémentaires qu’elle contient la rendent ambiguë, incorrecte ou incompréhensible.
2. Vous pouvez autoriser les fautes d’orthographe tant qu’elles ne nuisent pas à la compréhension ou qu’elles ne changent pas le sens de la phrase.
3. En ce qui concerne les questions de type vrai ou faux, les candidats peuvent cocher ou marquer d’une croix la réponse de leur choix, mais ils doivent
   rester cohérents. Si un candidat a utilisé deux coches ou deux croix pour la même réponse, attribuez [0]. Si un candidat a répondu par une croix et
   une coche à la même question, prenez en compte la coche et ignorez la croix.
4. En ce qui concerne les questions pour lesquelles le candidat doit écrire une lettre dans une case (par exemple, dans le cas de questions à choix
   multiple), s’il a donné deux réponses différentes, l’une à l’intérieur de la case et l’autre en-dehors, ne prenez en compte que la réponse qui se situe
   dans la case.
5. Le nombre total de points pour l’épreuve d’examen est de [40].

1. Las preguntas que requieran una respuesta corta deben responderse con claridad. No otorgue la puntuación si la respuesta no tiene sentido o si la
   información adicional hace que la respuesta sea ambigua, incorrecta o incomprensible.
2. Permita errores de ortografía siempre y cuando no dificulten la comprensión ni cambien el sentido de la oración.
3. En las preguntas de verdadero o falso, los alumnos podrán indicar la respuesta elegida con un tic o una cruz, pero el uso de los signos debe ser
   coherente. Si el alumno marca dos tics o dos cruces en la misma respuesta, otorgue la puntuación [0]. Si el alumno responde marcando una cruz y
   un tic en la misma respuesta, puntúe el tic e ignore la cruz.
4. En las preguntas que requieran escribir una letra en una casilla (por ejemplo, en las preguntas de opción múltiple), si el alumno ha escrito dos
   respuestas (una dentro de la casilla y la otra fuera), puntúe únicamente la respuesta marcada dentro de la casilla.
5. El número total de puntos asignados al cuestionario de examen es [40].
                                                                        –4–           N18/2/ANENG/SP1/ENG/TZ0/XX/M

Text A — What do you think of the food services at the University of Victoria?

 Question                 Target answer                                   Accept     Do not accept          Marks
 1.         B                                                                                                 1
 2.         B, C                                       in any order, award [1] for
                                                                                                              2
                                                       each letter
 3.         A, C                                       in any order, award [1] for
                                                                                                              2
                                                       each letter
 4.         A, E                                       in any order, award [1] for
                                                                                                              2
                                                       each letter
 5.         D, E                                       in any order, award [1] for
                                                                                                              2
                                                       each letter
 6.         for example                                                                                       1
 7.         although                                                                                          1
 8.         exactly                                                                                           1
       1.                                                                                        Total        12
                                                                         –5–                                           N18/2/ANENG/SP1/ENG/TZ0/XX/M

Text B — A graduate from Manchester University takes his skills back home to Tanzania

 Question                  Target answer                                   Accept                                     Do not accept                 Marks
 9.         successfully applied                        he successfully applied to study for a          Answers that begin with the phrase: “A
                                                        Masters in Science in Construction Project      friend told him about...”                     1
                                                        Management at the university
10.   a     (Ray’s) university fees                     in any order, award [1] for                     Answers that omit the words: “fees” and
      b     (his) living costs                          each answer                                     “costs/expenses”.

                                                        The candidate may answer this question
                                                        using whole sentences, eg:
                                                        • It/The scholarship paid (for his/Ray’s)                                                     2
                                                            university fees (for the year)
                                                        • Giving him enough money to pay for his
                                                            university fees
                                                        • It/The scholarship paid for his living
                                                            costs/expenses
11.         false                                       (he is now managing/the construction of)        only true/false
            inspired by similar systems in Latin        Africa’s first rapid bus system                 only a justification                          1
            America / Africa’s first rapid bus system
12.         true                                                                                        only true/false
            (as well as) Improving journey times                                                        only a justification
                                                                                                                                                      1
                                                                                                        DART is helping to make the city more
                                                                                                        accessible (...improving journey times.)
13.         true                                        •   its rapid growth is forcing policy makers   only true/false
            (its) rapid growth                              to improve… (ie ending in ellipsis)         only a justification
                                                        •   its rapid growth is forcing policy makers   its rapid growth is forcing policy makers     1
                                                            to improve planning (infrastructure and     to improve
                                                            environmental management in the city)
14.         false                                                                                       only true/false
            Mistakes made when the city was first                                                       only a justification                          1
            planned (are being corrected).

15.        (the) scholarship      scholarship at/to/for Manchester University
                                                                                                                      1
                                  Answers that include “it refers to…”
16.        gifts                  Answers that include “it refers to…”                                                1
17.        their entire country   (on their) entire country / their country     •   but on their entire country
                                                                                                                      1
                                                                                •   country
      2.                                                                                                    Total     10

Text C — Therapy dogs help patients

 Question                   Target answer                                   Accept                                     Do not accept                       Marks
18.         her owner takes out a white and red scarf   •   her owner takes out a white and red          •   and puts it on the dog
            and puts it on the dog                          scarf                                        •   she/he puts a scarf on
                                                        •   he puts a scarf on the dog
                                                                                                         Answers that do not follow the                      1
                                                                                                         instructions to complete the sentence
                                                                                                         and instead take the full sentence
                                                                                                         straight from the text "It is all fun until..."
19.         life outside the hospital                   about life outside the hospital                  Answers that do not follow the
                                                                                                         instructions to complete the sentence
                                                                                                         and write a whole sentence from the
                                                                                                         text.                                               1
                                                                                                         Answers that include words that repeat
                                                                                                         the meaning of “discuss”, such as
                                                                                                         “talk”.
20.         twice a week                                •   2/two times a week
                                                        •   Mia/she/it visits people in hospital twice                                                       1
                                                            a week (for the past two and half years)
21.         (the) program                               St. John’s Ambulance therapy program                                                                 1
22.         patients                                                                                                                                         1
23.         the attention is on the dog                 (the) dog therapy                                therapy                                             1
24.         D                                                                                                                                                1
25.         E                                                                                                                                                1
26.         G                                                                                                                                                1
      3.                                                                                                                                Total                9

Text D — About the Great Barrier Reef

 Question                 Target answer                                        Accept                                   Do not accept                 Marks
27.         (why/that) it is one of the seven wonders of   (why/that) it (the Great Barrier Reef) is the
            the natural world                              world’s largest and most complex coral reef                                                  1
                                                           system
28.         C, E                                           in any order, award [1] for
                                                                                                                                                        2
                                                           each letter
29.         (because of) its natural beauty                •   (many people will visit the Great Barrier    Answers that include that the Great
                                                               Reef) because of its natural beauty, (both   Barrier Reef is one of the world’s most
                                                               below and above the water’s surface)         popular tourist attractions.
                                                           •   because it has natural beauty

                                                           Answers in full sentences, eg:                                                               1
                                                           • It is very popular because of its natural
                                                              beauty.
                                                           • Because of its natural beauty (both below
                                                              and above the
                                                              water’s surface) it is very popular.
30.         D                                                                                                                                           1
31.         H                                                                                                                                           1
32.         G                                                                                                                                           1
33.         E                                                                                                                                           1
34.         I                                                                                                                                           1
       4.                                                                                                                            Total              9
